settings.heading: Kit Contents
settings.content:
• Konnected Garage Door Opener
  • Power Adapter
  • Hook-Up Wire
  • Mounting Hardware

settings.heading: Features
settings.content:
• Equipped with a highly accurate optical laser sensor to detect the status of your garage door (open or closed)
  • Compatible with SmartThings, Alexa, Hubitat, Home Assistant, and Control4*
  • Option to incorporate a wired sensor to enhance precision (not required, sold separately)
  • Cut costs by upgrading your existing setup
  • Connects effortlessly via Wi-Fi, eliminating the need for a separate hub
  • Provides both audible and visual alerts prior to closing
  • Access all functionalities without any recurring monthly fees
  • Operates without the need for batteries

*Control4 driver requires a paid site license.

settings.heading: Documentation
settings.content: Find the Konnected Garage Door Opener manual & documentation here.

settings.heading: Quick Start Guide
settings.content: üìÑ Garage Door Opener Quick Start Guide

settings.heading: Tech Specs
settings.content:
• Optical laser sensor
  • 12V power in (power adapter included)
  • 12V AUX power out
  • Input for wired sensor
  • Relay output to garage door opener switch
  • 12V switched output for strobe
  • USB port (for servicing firmware)
  • Built-in warning LED strobe light
  • Internal piezo buzzer

settings.heading: Make Your Old Garage Door Opener Smart

settings.text:
Konnected Garage Door Opener retrofits old wired garage door openers and brings them to the 21st century - without monthly fees.

After easy installation, users enjoy remote access to their garage door opener from anywhere via their favorite smart home platforms like SmartThings, Alexa, Hubitat, and Home Assistant.

settings.title: Updated processor
settings.content: Now built on the ESP32-S3-MINI, a more powerful and capable IoT chip that adds Bluetooth, BLE, and more memory and processing power to ensure future compatibility with evolving IoT standards like Matter.

settings.title: Multi-Tonal alarm
settings.content: Adds more pleasant and customizable warning tones thanks to an upgrade to the built-in sounder on the device.

settings.title: Check the Learn Button
settings.text:
Works with all non-Chamberlain brands (including Genie, Linear, Overhead Door) and Chamberlain/LiftMaster brands with green, gray, white, yellow (square) üü® learn button.

Got a Chamberlain/LiftMaster garage door opener with yellow, red, orange, blue, purple, or brown learn button, including those with myQ built-in? Get the GDO blaQ instead.

settings.title: Check the Wall Button
settings.text: Konnected‚Äôs Garage Door Opener works with most garage doors with a¬†wired¬†push-button mounted on the wall, a simple ‚Äúdry-contact‚Äù switch.

settings.title: Get an Adapter for Yellow-Button Openers
settings.text: If your garage door opener features a yellow learn button, it means it features Security+ 2.0. In order for Konnected Garage Door Opener to work with your Security+ 2.0. device, you'll need to grab one of the dry contact adapters from ismartgate or Garadget.

settings.title: Measure the Garage's Height
settings.text: The optical laser sensor works most reliably when the ceiling is¬†less than¬†~5-6 feet¬†from the rolled-up garage door. In typical homes with a standard 7ft garage door and ~8-13ft ceilings, this is no problem. We suggest adding a wired sensor to ensure accuracy if your garage ceiling exceeds those numbers.

settings.text:

settings.title: Built-In Optical Laser Sensor
settings.text:
Built-in to GDOv2-S

Best for:

  • most garages with ceilings at ~8-13ft
  • users who want the simplest installation & most common setup

settings.title: Built-In Optical Laser Sensor + Wired Sensor
settings.text:
Wired sensor sold separately.

Best for:

  • tall garages with ceilings higher than 13ft
  • users seeking an extra layer of accuracy in case the optical laser sensor gets obstructed (e.g., by a spider web or dust)

settings.title: How the Konnected Garage Door Opener Works
settings.description: Our Garage Door Opener retrofits your existing dumb garage door opener and adds smart functionality to it. More details at our knowledge base.

settings.heading: Watch Our Garage Door Opener In Action

settings.text:
Matter¬†is the emerging smart home standard that provides secure and¬†local¬†integration with all big-name smart home platforms, including Apple HomeKit, Google Home, Amazon Alexa, Samsung SmartThings, Home Assistant, Hubitat, and Homey Pro. Currently, the Matter specification does not support garage door opener device types, but when it does, Konnected is committed to supporting this game-changing standard on all of our GDOv2 models.

Note:¬†Upgrading to Matter will require re-flashing the device firmware with a computer and USB cable.

*Konnected‚Äôs Garage Door Opener is not (yet) Matter certified. Join our early-access program to stay up-to-date with development.

This product ships with ESPHome-based firmware pre-loaded for local, secure, and open-source integration with Home Assistant and Hubitat.

Konnected is committed to making this powerful DIY smart home firmware easy and accessible for all, which is why we‚Äôve created a cloud connector for ESPHome to integrate with SmartThings and Alexa.

Powerful, customizable, and plug-and play smart home integration with your choice of smart home platform.

settings.heading: Built on Open Source
settings.text:
Konnected‚Äôs new GDO is built on entirely open source software, made with high-quality genuine components, and assembled with love in the USA. We designed it with an emphasis on choice, privacy, and local control ‚Äì because we believe that the technology that you bring in your home is yours to own. The GDOv2‚Äôs firmware configuration is published here on GitHub and is built upon these primary open-source libraries:

  • esphome-ratgdo (GPL v2)
  • esphome (ESPHome License)
  • esp-idf (Apache v2)

settings.title: What's the Best Smart Garage Door Opener?
What Is a Smart Garage Door Opener?
5 Ways to Use Konnected Garage Door Opener
Learn More About Our Smart Garage Door Opener

settings.heading: How do I know if my garage door opener is compatible?
settings.row_content: Konnected's GDO White works with garage door openers that are triggered to open or close by a simple push button or dry-contact closure. This includes most garage door openers except those with a yellow learn button. Read more.

settings.heading: What if my garage door opener has a yellow learn button or has myQ built-in?
settings.row_content: Check out our new GDO blaQ that is specifically designed for yellow-button Security+ 2.0 openers.

settings.heading: Will my existing garage door remotes (car, wall, and outside keypad) still work?
settings.row_content:
Yes, of course, they will still work. Konnected only makes your garage smarter; it doesn't take away any existing features.

Noticing decreased range of your wireless remotes?

settings.heading: What if I have more than one garage door?
settings.row_content: Konnected's GDO monitors and controls a single garage door opener. You'll need one Konnected Smart Garage Door Opener product per garage door.

settings.heading: Is there an audible and visual warning before closing the garage door?
settings.row_content:
Yes, for safety, the GDO gives you visual (blinking) and audible (beeping) warnings for ~5 seconds before it triggers the garage door to close.¬†

NEW in 2024: The GDOv2 has a multi-tonal sounder that can more pleasant and customizable warning tunes.

settings.heading: Does it meet U.S. safety regulations?
settings.row_content:
Yes, the GDOv2-S was designed to meet the U.S. safety regulations in 16 CFR ¬ß 1211.14 for the unattended operation of a residential garage door opener.

The device should only be used with a sectional garage door. Do not use with one-piece or swinging doors.

settings.heading: Should I get a wired sensor for my Smart Garage Door Opener?
settings.row_content:
There are three main reasons to add an optional heavy-duty wired sensor to your Konnected Garage Door Opener:¬†

  • your garage's ceiling is very high (more than 8-10 ft)
  • you want an extra layer of accuracy in case the optical sensor gets obstructed (e.g., by dust or spider web)
  • you trust wired sensors more than any other sensors

settings.heading: How is it powered?
settings.row_content: It's powered by a 12V power adapter (included) which plugs into a standard power outlet. Usually, the garage door opener receives power from a power outlet on the garage ceiling. No batteries required.

settings.heading: Are there monthly fees?
settings.row_content: There are no ongoing fees to use Konnected's Garage Door Opener. In the future, we may introduce optional premium features for a fee.

settings.heading: Does it work with a gate opener?
settings.row_content:
In many cases, yes! If the gate opener is triggered by a push-button or dry-contact relay, then yes it should work. However, you will likely not be able to use the built-in optical sensor to detect the open/closed status. Instead, you can use a wired sensor to monitor the state of the gate.

The Konnected GDO should be installed in a weather-protected environment.

settings.heading: What smart home platforms or apps does it work with?
settings.row_content:
Konnected's GDO works with Home Assistant and Hubitat via a 100% local integration using the ESPHome native API.

It also works with SmartThings and Alexa via a connection to Konnected's free Konnected Cloud service.

settings.heading: When will Matter compatibility be ready?
settings.row_content:
We really don't know. At the present time, there is no a Matter specification for garage door openers. We're watching the Matter release schedule closely and are expecting to start testing a Matter compatible firmware as soon as the device specification is made available by the Matter working group.

You can join our Matter early-access program to stay informed of the progress.

settings.heading: Is there an API for the device?
settings.row_content: Yes! Konnected's GDO family have a full-featured and local REST API, as well as the ESPHome Native API. See API Reference.
